basic_information.scholarship_name: Jeanne Marie (Jean) Barthell Endowed Memorial Scholarship

description: This scholarship honors the memory of Jeanne Marie (Jean) Barthell, mother of John Barthell. From her obituary, Jean received a diploma from Parks School of Business in Denver, CO, and then attended the University of Colorado in Boulder, earning a BA in English Literature in 1957, with a minor in French. Literature, painting, theatre, and, above all, symphonic music fed her soul. Jean loved all things French, as a sensible person must, inspiring her to change her nom préféré to 'Jeanne Marie'." Eligibility Requirements Graduate or Undergraduate student in either the Department of English or the Department of Modern Languages, Literatures, and Cultural Studies Preference given to first-generation undergraduates with a French major Preference given to a student who studied abroad or participated in a study tour Minimum 2.75 GPA Continuing student in the fall semester the scholarship is awarded
